content: sisterhood scarf knitting pattern about the scarf sisterhood scarf is a cozy hooded scarf worked in a classic 1×1 rib designed to be both practical and stylish it begins with a softly pointed hood that flows seamlessly into a long scarf perfect for draping over the shoulder the ribbed texture creates a warm comfortable fabric while clean lines give the design a timeless effortless look easy to wear and style the sisterhood scarf is ideal for everyday layering on colder days warm chic and relaxed it s a piece you ll reach for again and again yarn pattern any worsted or aran weight yarn cast on 66 stitches with colour a 50g/100m is optimal about 200 g of each colour continue back and forth in colour a slip 1 with yarn in front *knit 1 purl 1* repeat *-* until 1 stitch remaining knit 1 other supplies knit this row a total of 2 times change to colour b do not cut the yarn between 4 mm needles stripes darning needle slip 1 with yarn in front *knit 1 purl 1* repeat *-* until 1 stitch remaining knit 1 knit this row a total of 2 times gauge repeat these row until work measures 200 cm or 22 stitches / 20 row = 10 cm until you run out of yarn cast off in rib pattern blocked in 1x1 rib fold the scarf in half and sew the sides together using mattress stitch start at the fold and stop after 20 cm weave in loose threads and block your scarf you can add a little bit of length to the scarf by blocking #sisterhoodscarf sandra snellman ©copyright 2025 this pattern is for personal use only and may not be copied @purlgurl__ sold or otherwise distributed
